constraints.customMessage: For security reasons, please re-enter all secret token(s) before saving the settings.

description: Although the Dynatrace mobile app is the preferred method for receiving real-time notifications related to problems in your environment, if your organization uses email or a different ticket/incident management system for alerting, click Add notification to configure integration with Dynatrace.
documentation:
Integrate Dynatrace problem notifications with your organization's existing incident-management system or team-collaboration channel. Alerting profiles are used within problem integrations to filter the total number of alerts to a subset that is relevant for your team.

For details see [Third-party integrations](https://dt-url.net/j803tgc).

alertingProfile.description: Select an [alerting profile](/ui/settings/builtin:alerting.profile) to control the delivery of problem notifications related to this integration.

displayName.description: The name of the notification configuration.

acceptAnyCertificate.displayName: Accept any SSL certificate (including self-signed and invalid certificates)

customMessage.description: This message will be displayed in the Extra Variables **Message** field of your job template. Type '{' for placeholder suggestions.
customMessage.documentation:
#### Available placeholders
**{ImpactedEntities}**: Details about the entities impacted by the problem in form of a json array.

**{ImpactedEntity}**: A short description of the problem and impacted entity (or multiple impacted entities).

**{ImpactedEntityNames}**: The entity impacted by the problem.

**{NamesOfImpactedEntities}**: The names of all entities that are impacted by the problem.

**{PID}**: Unique system identifier of the reported problem.

**{ProblemDetailsText}**: All problem event details including root cause as a text-formatted string.

**{ProblemID}**: Display number of the reported problem.

**{ProblemImpact}**: Impact level of the problem. Possible values are APPLICATION, SERVICE, or INFRASTRUCTURE.

**{ProblemSeverity}**: Severity level of the problem. Possible values are AVAILABILITY, ERROR, PERFORMANCE, RESOURCE_CONTENTION, or CUSTOM_ALERT.

**{ProblemTitle}**: Short description of the problem.

**{ProblemURL}**: URL of the problem within Dynatrace.

**{State}**: Problem state. Possible values are OPEN or RESOLVED.

**{Tags}**: Comma separated list of tags that are defined for all impacted entities. To refer to the value of a specific tag, specify the tag's key in square brackets: **{Tags[key]}**. If the tag does not have any assigned value, the placeholder will be replaced by an empty string. The placeholder will not be replaced if the tag key does not exist.

constraints.customMessage: Job template URL should be in the format of http(s)://<Ansible server name>/#/templates/job_template/<JobTemplateID>

jobTemplateURL.description:
The URL of the target job template.

For example, https://<Ansible server name>/#/templates/job_template/<JobTemplateID>

**Note:** Be sure to select the **Prompt on Launch** option in the Extra Variables section of your job template configuration.

body.description: The template of the email notifications. Type '{' for placeholder suggestions.
body.documentation:
#### Available placeholders
**{ImpactedEntities}**: Details about the entities impacted by the problem in form of a json array.

**{ImpactedEntity}**: A short description of the problem and impacted entity (or multiple impacted entities).

**{ImpactedEntityNames}**: The entity impacted by the problem.

**{NamesOfImpactedEntities}**: The names of all entities that are impacted by the problem.

**{PID}**: Unique system identifier of the reported problem.

**{ProblemDetailsHTML}**: All problem event details including root cause as an HTML-formatted string.

**{ProblemDetailsJSONv2}**: Problem as json object following the structure from the [Dynatrace Problems V2 API](https://dt-url.net/7a03ti2). The optional fields evidenceDetails and impactAnalysis are included, but recentComments is not.

**{ProblemDetailsJSON}**: Problem as json object following the structure from the [Dynatrace Problems V1 API](https://dt-url.net/qn23tk2).

**{ProblemDetailsMarkdown}**: All problem event details including root cause as a Markdown-formatted string.

**{ProblemDetailsText}**: All problem event details including root cause as a text-formatted string.

**{ProblemID}**: Display number of the reported problem.

**{ProblemImpact}**: Impact level of the problem. Possible values are APPLICATION, SERVICE, or INFRASTRUCTURE.

**{ProblemSeverity}**: Severity level of the problem. Possible values are AVAILABILITY, ERROR, PERFORMANCE, RESOURCE_CONTENTION, or CUSTOM_ALERT.

**{ProblemTitle}**: Short description of the problem.

**{ProblemURL}**: URL of the problem within Dynatrace.

**{State}**: Problem state. Possible values are OPEN or RESOLVED.

**{Tags}**: Comma separated list of tags that are defined for all impacted entities. To refer to the value of a specific tag, specify the tag's key in square brackets: **{Tags[key]}**. If the tag does not have any assigned value, the placeholder will be replaced by an empty string. The placeholder will not be replaced if the tag key does not exist.

notifyClosedProblems.displayName: Send email if problem is closed

apiToken.description: The API token for the Jira profile. Using password authentication [was deprecated by Jira](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-basic-auth-and-cookie-based-auth/)

description.description: The description of the Jira issue to be created by this notification. Type '{' for placeholder suggestions.

issueType.description:
The type of the Jira issue to be created by this notification.

To find all available issue types, or to create your own issue type, within JIRA go to Options > Issues.

projectKey.description: The project key of the Jira issue to be created by this notification.

summary.description: The summary of the Jira issue to be created by this notification. Type '{' for placeholder suggestions.

url.description: The URL of the Jira API endpoint.

username.description: The username of the Jira profile.

constraints.customMessage: For security reasons, we only allow HTTPS endpoints

authenticateViaRequestHeader.description: If false, the client credentials are included in the HTTP request body.
authenticateViaRequestHeader.displayName: Include the client credentials in the HTTP "Authorization" request header field with the HTTP "Basic" authentication scheme.

scope.description: The scope of access you are requesting

OAuth2Credentials.versionInfo: Add OAuth2 support including the client credentials in the HTTP "Authorization" request header field with the HTTP "Basic" authentication scheme.

apiKey.description:
The API key to access OpsGenie.

Go to OpsGenie-Integrations and create a new Dynatrace integration. Copy the newly created API key.

constraints.customMessage: OpsGenie region domain must not start with http:// or https://

domain.description:
The region domain of the OpsGenie.

For example, **api.opsgenie.com** for US or **api.eu.opsgenie.com** for EU.

message.description: The content of the message. Type '{' for placeholder suggestions.
message.documentation:
#### Available placeholders
**{ProblemID}**: Display number of the reported problem.

**{ProblemImpact}**: Impact level of the problem. Possible values are APPLICATION, SERVICE, or INFRASTRUCTURE.

**{ProblemSeverity}**: Severity level of the problem. Possible values are AVAILABILITY, ERROR, PERFORMANCE, RESOURCE_CONTENTION, or CUSTOM_ALERT.

**{ProblemTitle}**: Short description of the problem.

**{ImpactedEntityNames}**: The entity impacted by the problem (or multiple impacted entities).

account.description: The name of the PagerDuty account.

serviceApiKey.description: The Events API key to access PagerDuty.

formatProblemDetailsAsText.displayName: Use text format for problem details instead of HTML.

instanceName.description:
The ServiceNow instance identifier. It refers to the first part of your own ServiceNow URL. 

 This field is mutually exclusive with the **url** field. You can only use one of them.

message.description: The content of the ServiceNow description. Type '{' for placeholder suggestions.
message.documentation:
#### Available placeholders
**{ImpactedEntity}**: A short description of the problem and impacted entity (or multiple impacted entities).

**{ImpactedEntityNames}**: The entity impacted by the problem.

**{NamesOfImpactedEntities}**: The names of all entities that are impacted by the problem.

**{PID}**: Unique system identifier of the reported problem.

**{ProblemDetailsHTML}**: All problem event details including root cause as an HTML-formatted string.

**{ProblemDetailsText}**: All problem event details including root cause as a text-formatted string.

**{ProblemID}**: Display number of the reported problem.

**{ProblemImpact}**: Impact level of the problem. Possible values are APPLICATION, SERVICE, or INFRASTRUCTURE.

**{ProblemSeverity}**: Severity level of the problem. Possible values are AVAILABILITY, ERROR, PERFORMANCE, RESOURCE_CONTENTION, or CUSTOM_ALERT.

**{ProblemTitle}**: Short description of the problem.

**{State}**: Problem state. Possible values are OPEN or RESOLVED.

**{Tags}**: Comma separated list of tags that are defined for all impacted entities. To refer to the value of a specific tag, specify the tag's key in square brackets: **{Tags[key]}**. If the tag does not have any assigned value, the placeholder will be replaced by an empty string. The placeholder will not be replaced if the tag key does not exist.

password.description: The password to the ServiceNow account.

url.description:
The URL of the on-premise ServiceNow installation. 

 This field is mutually exclusive with the **instanceName** field. You can only use one of them.

username.description:
The username of the ServiceNow account. 

 Make sure that your user account has the `web_service_admin` and `x_dynat_ruxit.Integration` roles.

channel.description: The channel (for example, `#general`) or the user (for example, `@john.smith`) to send the message to.

message.description: The content of the message. Type '{' for placeholder suggestions.

url.description: Set up an incoming WebHook integration within your Slack account. Copy and paste the generated WebHook URL into the field above.

applicationKey.description:
The application key for the Trello account.

You must be logged into Trello to have Trello automatically generate an application key for you. [Get application key](https://trello.com/app-key)

authorizationToken.description: The authorization token for the Trello account.

boardId.displayName: Trello board ID problem cards should be assigned to

apiKey.description:
The API key for the target VictorOps account.

Receive your VictorOps API key by navigating to: Settings -> Integrations -> Rest Endpoint -> Dynatrace within your VictorOps account.

message.description: The content of the message. Type '{' for placeholder suggestions.

#### Available placeholders

**{NamesOfImpactedEntities}**: The names of all entities that are impacted by the problem.

**{ProblemDetailsText}**: All problem event details including root cause as a text-formatted string.

routingKey.description: The routing key, defining the group to be notified.

acceptAnyCertificate.displayName: Accept any SSL certificate (including self-signed and invalid certificates)

headers.description: A list of the additional HTTP headers.

notifyClosedProblems.displayName: Call webhook if problem is closed

notifyEventMergesEnabled.displayName: Call webhook if new events merge into existing problems

oAuth2Credentials.description:
To authenticate your integration, the OAuth 2.0 *Client Credentials* Flow (Grant Type) is used. For details see [Client Credentials Flow](https://dt-url.net/ym22wsm)).

The obtained Access Token is subsequently provided in the *Authorization* header of the request carrying the notification payload.

payload.description: The content of the notification message. Type '{' for placeholder suggestions.

If the tag does not have any assigned value, the placeholder will be replaced by an empty string. The placeholder will not be replaced if the tag key does not exist.

secretUrl.description: The secret URL of the webhook endpoint.

url.description: The URL of the webhook endpoint.

name.description: The name of the HTTP header.

secretValue.description: The secret value of the HTTP header. May contain an empty value.

value.description: The value of the HTTP header. May contain an empty value.
